title: Finally a Female Minifigure Attached to the City Comic
review:
Overview

Tina Tough has the honour of being the first female Minifigure to come with the Lego City Comic.  It only took 15 issues, which covers the period 22nd March 2017 to 28th May 2019.  She is also the pilot of the Gyrocopter (as per the title of the set), but Helicopter as noted on the cover of the comic. 

Following the last issue the price has reduced from £4.99 to £4.25.  You only get one set of Lego with this comic, whereas the last edition had a extra one, so the value is Ok but I think £3.99 would probably have been fairer due to only getting 29 pieces.

Packet

The wider foil packet is employed to hold the Minifigure and pieces, which is does well enough.  My only dislike of the newer packets are that they tend to split when opening unless you are extra careful.

Minifigure

As noted above, Tina Tough is the first female Minifigure to be supplied on the City Comic.  Lego may have felt that the other comics and City sets covered this, but great to see.  The Tina Minifigure also comes with 60217: Fire Plane, so this is an inexpensive way to get her.

Main Build/Parts

These sets can give you some nice pieces for little cost, however other than the Cool Yellow 1x2 plates, new to City sets for 2019 but around for a couple of years, that you get two of I wouldn't imagine people will be grabbing the comic for the parts.

The build is simple, but a little too blocky for my liking.  It looks like something that a brand other than Lego would put in a small box and if all the 2019 Fire sets were displayed together this probably wouldn't look right.

This is likely to be a set that quickly gets taken apart and ends up being used to build something else.

Verdict

I do like what they tried to do, but a Gyrocopter/Helicopter that puts fire out with a hand held fire extinguisher doesn't provide much playability - maybe a handheld stud shooter could have added some playability with possibly a simple small tree (like 60001 from 2013) and a flame element to knock down.

If you didn't get this the first time around then you probably haven't missed out.

If it was not for the first female Minifigure on the City Comic I would have scored this 1, but an extra point had to be awarded.  On a similar note the parts gets two as you do have a slightly rare colour element with the Cool Yellow and the Playability is boosted as you can swoosh it with the rotor blades spinning nicely.

The next issue will contain a Diver Dude and an Underwater World!
